result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Joseph Leisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation today.  If revoked, time totals 25 months Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Remainder of bond to go to fines.  The outstanding balance to be paid through a payment plan of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on September 1, 2015 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Absolute Sobriety.  Subject to testing to determine compliance.  
Cannot vote or hold public office.
If not a US citizen, could face deportation.

Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.  
Must successfully complete Drug Court.
$150.00 from bond to be transferred to DA's Office for DJOC fee in Case 15CF173.

CASES: 15CF74, 15CF173 Defendant Steven Joseph Leisch in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 9:03AM State files amended info in 15CF74. 

15CF74 Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4- Def plea of G. CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC. 

15CF173 Ct 1- Def plea of G. CT accepts pleas, finds G as repeater, does not enter JOC due to DJOC. TERM: 5 yrs. DJOC fee of $150 w/in 60 days. 


SENTENCING: 
15CF74 Ct 2: I/S 3 yrs, 6 mos 1.5 IC and 2 ES
              Ct 3: I/S 6 mos in jail
              Ct 4: 30 days in jail
if revoked that totals 25 mos in, 2 yrs ES
run consecutively to one another. 
prob- 4 yrs, appear today. 
bank 180 days in jail for agent to use if necessary. 
AS, sub to testing, AODA & comply, succ completion of Drug Court, $265.60 on 2 misd, $290.60 on felony, cannot possess firearm/body armor, cannot vote or hold public office, if not US Citizen could be deported. 
DNA sample & $250 surcharge. 
$150 from bond to be transferred to DA's office for DJOC fee, remainder to go to fines, remainder to be paid thru a PP of $25/mo beg 9/1/15 and 1st of e/m thereafter. 
15CF74 DRI, as well as February 2015 uncharged conduct. 9:30am adj.
